etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Samuel Taylor Coleridge (1772–1834), poet, critic, and philosopher. From person + -eity, perhaps after corporeity

definitions: That which constitutes a person or (especially) God; personal or divine essence; personality. Also : a being (especially God) having the nature of a person; a personage.

notes.text: Now chiefly with reference to Coleridge's use.
